DataElement.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Dysphasia Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the common toxicity criteria adverse event dysphasia grade.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria Adverse Event Dysphasia
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._A disorder characterized by impairment of verbal communication skills, often resulting from brain damage.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by impairment of verbal communication skills, often resulting from brain damage.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by impairment of verbal communication skills, often resulting from brain damage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Moderate receptive or expressive characteristics; impairing ability to communicate spontaneously
